content:
InputLanguageManager Class

In this Article

Provides facilities for managing input languages in Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF).

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class InputLanguageManager : System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherObject

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherObject
  • InputLanguageManager

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()
,
CheckAccess()
,
Dispatcher
,
VerifyAccess()

Remarks

Additional languages can be registered by using the Regional and Language Options control panel. From the Languages tab, select "Text Services and input languages", then click the "Details" button to register additional languages. The following dialog appears.

Fields summary

InputLanguageProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.InputLanguage* attached property.
RestoreInputLanguageProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.RestoreInputLanguage* attached property.

Properties summary

AvailableInputLanguages

Gets an enumerator for currently available input languages.
Current

Gets the input language manager associated with the current context.
CurrentInputLanguage

Gets or sets the current input language.

Methods summary

GetInputLanguage(DependencyObject)

Returns the value of the stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.InputLanguage* attached property for a specified dependency object.
GetRestoreInputLanguage(DependencyObject)

Returns the value of stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.RestoreInputLanguage* attached property for a specified dependency object.
RegisterInputLanguageSource(IInputLanguageSource)

Registers an input language source with the InputLanguageManager.
ReportInputLanguageChanged(CultureInfo,CultureInfo)

Report the completion of a change of input language to the InputLanguageManager.
ReportInputLanguageChanging(CultureInfo,CultureInfo)

Report the initiation of a change of input language to the InputLanguageManager.
SetInputLanguage(DependencyObject,CultureInfo)

Sets the value of the stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.InputLanguage* attached property on the specified dependency object.
SetRestoreInputLanguage(DependencyObject,Boolean)

Sets the value of the stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.RestoreInputLanguage* dependency property on the specified dependency object.

Events summary

InputLanguageChanged

Occurs when a change of input language is completed.
InputLanguageChanging

Occurs when a change of input language is initiated.

Fields

  • InputLanguageProperty

    Identifies the stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.InputLanguage* attached property.

    public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty InputLanguageProperty;
  • RestoreInputLanguageProperty

    Identifies the stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.RestoreInputLanguage* attached property.

    public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty RestoreInputLanguageProperty;

Properties

  • AvailableInputLanguages

    Gets an enumerator for currently available input languages.

    public System.Collections.IEnumerable AvailableInputLanguages { get; }

    Property Value

    • IEnumerable

      An enumerator for currently available input languages, or null if no input languages are available.

      This property has no default value.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use an InputLanguageManager to enumerate the available input languages. 

    Me.Dispatcher.Thread.CurrentCulture.Name.ToString()
InputLanguageManager.SetInputLanguage(myTextBox, CultureInfo.CreateSpecificCulture("fr"))
tb2.Text = "Available Input Languages:"
lb1.ItemsSource = InputLanguageManager.Current.AvailableInputLanguages
tb3.Text = "Input Language of myTextBox is " & InputLanguageManager.GetInputLanguage(myTextBox).ToString()
tb4.Text = "CurrentCulture is Set to " & Me.Dispatcher.Thread.CurrentCulture.Name.ToString()

    this.Dispatcher.Thread.CurrentCulture.Name.ToString();
InputLanguageManager.SetInputLanguage(myTextBox, CultureInfo.CreateSpecificCulture("fr"));
tb2.Text = "Available Input Languages:";
lb1.ItemsSource = InputLanguageManager.Current.AvailableInputLanguages;
tb3.Text = "Input Language of myTextBox is " + InputLanguageManager.GetInputLanguage(myTextBox).ToString();
tb4.Text = "CurrentCulture is Set to " + this.Dispatcher.Thread.CurrentCulture.Name.ToString();
  • Current

    Gets the input language manager associated with the current context.

    public static System.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager Current { get; }

    Property Value

    • InputLanguageManager

      An InputLanguageManager object associated with the current context.

      This property has no default value.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use an InputLanguageManager to access the language manager associated with the current context. 

    Me.Dispatcher.Thread.CurrentCulture.Name.ToString()
InputLanguageManager.SetInputLanguage(myTextBox, CultureInfo.CreateSpecificCulture("fr"))
tb2.Text = "Available Input Languages:"
lb1.ItemsSource = InputLanguageManager.Current.AvailableInputLanguages
tb3.Text = "Input Language of myTextBox is " & InputLanguageManager.GetInputLanguage(myTextBox).ToString()
tb4.Text = "CurrentCulture is Set to " & Me.Dispatcher.Thread.CurrentCulture.Name.ToString()

    this.Dispatcher.Thread.CurrentCulture.Name.ToString();
InputLanguageManager.SetInputLanguage(myTextBox, CultureInfo.CreateSpecificCulture("fr"));
tb2.Text = "Available Input Languages:";
lb1.ItemsSource = InputLanguageManager.Current.AvailableInputLanguages;
tb3.Text = "Input Language of myTextBox is " + InputLanguageManager.GetInputLanguage(myTextBox).ToString();
tb4.Text = "CurrentCulture is Set to " + this.Dispatcher.Thread.CurrentCulture.Name.ToString();
  • CurrentInputLanguage

    Gets or sets the current input language.

    public System.Globalization.CultureInfo CurrentInputLanguage { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • CultureInfo

      A CultureInfo object representing the currently selected input language. This property may not be set to null.

      The default value is stem.Globalization.CultureInfo.InvariantCulture*.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      Raised when an attempt is made to set this property to null.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use an InputLanguageManager to get the current input language. 

    InputLanguageManager.SetInputLanguage(tb1, CultureInfo.CreateSpecificCulture("fr"))
tb1.Text = "Current Input Language is " & InputLanguageManager.Current.CurrentInputLanguage.ToString()

    InputLanguageManager.SetInputLanguage(tb1, CultureInfo.CreateSpecificCulture("fr"));
tb1.Text = "Current Input Language is " + InputLanguageManager.Current.CurrentInputLanguage.ToString();

Methods

  • GetInputLanguage(DependencyObject)

    Returns the value of the stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.InputLanguage* attached property for a specified dependency object.

    public static System.Globalization.CultureInfo GetInputLanguage (System.Windows.DependencyObject target);

    Parameters

    • target
      DependencyObject

      The dependency object for which to retrieve the input language.

    Returns

    • CultureInfo

      A CultureInfo object representing the input language for the specified dependency object.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      Raised when target is null.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use an InputLanguageManager to get the input language of a TextBox element. 

    Me.Dispatcher.Thread.CurrentCulture.Name.ToString()
InputLanguageManager.SetInputLanguage(myTextBox, CultureInfo.CreateSpecificCulture("fr"))
tb2.Text = "Available Input Languages:"
lb1.ItemsSource = InputLanguageManager.Current.AvailableInputLanguages
tb3.Text = "Input Language of myTextBox is " & InputLanguageManager.GetInputLanguage(myTextBox).ToString()
tb4.Text = "CurrentCulture is Set to " & Me.Dispatcher.Thread.CurrentCulture.Name.ToString()

    this.Dispatcher.Thread.CurrentCulture.Name.ToString();
InputLanguageManager.SetInputLanguage(myTextBox, CultureInfo.CreateSpecificCulture("fr"));
tb2.Text = "Available Input Languages:";
lb1.ItemsSource = InputLanguageManager.Current.AvailableInputLanguages;
tb3.Text = "Input Language of myTextBox is " + InputLanguageManager.GetInputLanguage(myTextBox).ToString();
tb4.Text = "CurrentCulture is Set to " + this.Dispatcher.Thread.CurrentCulture.Name.ToString();
  • GetRestoreInputLanguage(DependencyObject)

    Returns the value of stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.RestoreInputLanguage* attached property for a specified dependency object.

    public static bool GetRestoreInputLanguage (System.Windows.DependencyObject target);

    Parameters

    • target
      DependencyObject

      The dependency object for which to retrieve the value of stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.RestoreInputLanguage*.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      The current value of stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.RestoreInputLanguage* for the specified dependency object.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      Raised when target is null.

  • RegisterInputLanguageSource(IInputLanguageSource)

    Registers an input language source with the InputLanguageManager.

    public void RegisterInputLanguageSource (System.Windows.Input.IInputLanguageSource inputLanguageSource);

    Parameters

    • inputLanguageSource
      IInputLanguageSource

      An object that specifies the input language to register. This object must implement the IInputLanguageSource interface.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      Raised when inputLanguageSource is null.

  • ReportInputLanguageChanged(CultureInfo,CultureInfo)

    Report the completion of a change of input language to the InputLanguageManager.

    public void ReportInputLanguageChanged (System.Globalization.CultureInfo newLanguageId, System.Globalization.CultureInfo previousLanguageId);

    Parameters

    • newLanguageId
      CultureInfo

      A CultureInfo object representing the new input language.

    • previousLanguageId
      CultureInfo

      A CultureInfo object representing the previous input language.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      Raised when newLanguageId or previousLanguageId is null.

  • ReportInputLanguageChanging(CultureInfo,CultureInfo)

    Report the initiation of a change of input language to the InputLanguageManager.

    public bool ReportInputLanguageChanging (System.Globalization.CultureInfo newLanguageId, System.Globalization.CultureInfo previousLanguageId);

    Parameters

    • newLanguageId
      CultureInfo

      A CultureInfo object representing the new input language.

    • previousLanguageId
      CultureInfo

      A CultureInfo object representing the previous input language.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true to indicate that the reported change of input language was accepted; otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      Raised when newLanguageId or previousLanguageId is null.

  • SetInputLanguage(DependencyObject,CultureInfo)

    Sets the value of the stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.InputLanguage* attached property on the specified dependency object.

    public static void SetInputLanguage (System.Windows.DependencyObject target, System.Globalization.CultureInfo inputLanguage);

    Parameters

    • target
      DependencyObject

      The dependency object on which to set the stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.InputLanguage* attached property.

    • inputLanguage
      CultureInfo

      A CultureInfo object representing the new value for the stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.InputLanguage* attached property.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      Raised when target is null.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use an InputLanguageManager to set the input language of a TextBox element. 

    Me.Dispatcher.Thread.CurrentCulture.Name.ToString()
InputLanguageManager.SetInputLanguage(myTextBox, CultureInfo.CreateSpecificCulture("fr"))
tb2.Text = "Available Input Languages:"
lb1.ItemsSource = InputLanguageManager.Current.AvailableInputLanguages
tb3.Text = "Input Language of myTextBox is " & InputLanguageManager.GetInputLanguage(myTextBox).ToString()
tb4.Text = "CurrentCulture is Set to " & Me.Dispatcher.Thread.CurrentCulture.Name.ToString()

    this.Dispatcher.Thread.CurrentCulture.Name.ToString();
InputLanguageManager.SetInputLanguage(myTextBox, CultureInfo.CreateSpecificCulture("fr"));
tb2.Text = "Available Input Languages:";
lb1.ItemsSource = InputLanguageManager.Current.AvailableInputLanguages;
tb3.Text = "Input Language of myTextBox is " + InputLanguageManager.GetInputLanguage(myTextBox).ToString();
tb4.Text = "CurrentCulture is Set to " + this.Dispatcher.Thread.CurrentCulture.Name.ToString();
  • SetRestoreInputLanguage(DependencyObject,Boolean)

    Sets the value of the stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.RestoreInputLanguage* dependency property on the specified dependency object.

    public static void SetRestoreInputLanguage (System.Windows.DependencyObject target, bool restore);

    Parameters

    • target
      DependencyObject

      The dependency object for which to set the value of stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.RestoreInputLanguage*.

    • restore
      Boolean

      A Boolean value to set the stem.Windows.Input.InputLanguageManager.RestoreInputLanguage* attached property to.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      Raised when target is null.

Events

  • InputLanguageChanged

    Occurs when a change of input language is completed.

    public event System.Windows.Input.InputLanguageEventHandler InputLanguageChanged;
  • InputLanguageChanging

    Occurs when a change of input language is initiated.

    public event System.Windows.Input.InputLanguageEventHandler InputLanguageChanging;
